title: Cannot install *any* plugin
content:
Hello,

On my different installs of Tbird (3 computers, all using Tb 102), it has become impossible to install any plugin, either from Tbird site or from a previously downloaded file. Cannot say when this started, since I very infrequently install plugins on TBird.

Previously installed plugins work ok and can be updated.

Whenever I try to install a plugin, I get to the permission window (Install XXX ? This extension will have permission to such and such). Clicking on the Accept or Cancel button has no visible effect, the window stays there, but the error console displays this message :

PopupNotifications._onButtonEvent: Button click happened before the window was focused

Any idea on how to solve this problem ?

Gentoo user, Awesome window manager. Everything as close to up to date as possible.

Thanks.

title: Search Won't Show 2023 Emails & Open Message in Conversation Not Working
content:

2. When I Right Click to "Open Message in Conversation" the option isn't there.

What would be the smartest way to rectify this issue? I'm assuming an uninstall and reinstall might do the trick but I also read that potentially I can delete a file which will result in Thunderbird recreating it when opening again, which may do the trick.

Thanks in advance for your help.
creator: SumoBot

title: Quick Steps in Thunderbird
content:
After migrating from Outlook, there is a mayor feature missing for me: "Quick Steps"

In Outlook a Quick Step is basically multiple actions in one and the user can custom build each Quick Step. In Outlook one can have a bar at the top with multiple user-definded Quick Steps.

An example for a quick step: tag as "urgent" AND tag as "unimportant" AND move to Folder "Receipts". All done on a single click. No drag and drop.

In Thunderbird, I have to mark the email manually twice, and then move it to the respective folder via drag and drop. That is a lot more effort.

Quick Steps is not the same as filters, it is complementary but very different. I also use filters. BUT, Quick Steps is used when it cannot be done automatically, when the user wants to decide manually, but still save on a lot of clicking and mouse movement.

Is there any such add-on in Thunderbird? Any plan to implement such a feature in Thunderbird?
creator: energy.polka486

title: Attachments with multiple large jpgs
content:
Thunderbird has recently, last 2-3 weeks, started to truncate attachments to my incoming emails. These attachments generally contain 15-20 jpgs, totaling about 6-7 MBs. It just chops off the attachments at an arbitrary point usually at about the 2-3 MB mark. I recieve these emails daily from a friend and have for years using Thunderbird without a problem.

I strongly suspect Thunderbird is responsible because if I download the same email with my Android tablet, not using Thunderbird, I retrieve the entire attachments.

Does anyone have any ideas?

title: How Do I Merge Emails From Different Profiles?
content:
Hello:

Over the years I've created different profiles on a number of different laptops/desktops.

I've saved all the email into my local folders, and under the locals folder in each profile I created the same exact folders/sub folders each time.

And so, for instance, every profile that I've created has a local folder, and under the local folder in each profile I have a sub-folder called "Shopping", and in the sub-folder "Shopping" I have additional nested folders that are called Amazon, Walgreens, Home Depot, Lowes, Walmart etc.

Well I'm getting a new laptop tomorrow, and once again I'll be creating a new profile.

In the new profile I'll be able to bring the local folders/sub-folders/nested folders from my last profile into the new profile that I will have created, but have no idea how to gather up all of the emails that I saved from all of the old profiles.

I'm thinking that if I attempt to gather them all together, I won't be able to because all of those older emails are saved to the exact same sub-folders/nested folders that will exist once I bring them into the newest profile that I created.

I figure that I might get a message from Thunderbird telling me that I can't bring those older sub-folders and nested folders into the account because at that point they already exist.

So is there a way to recover all of those older emails that I have saved WITHOUT having to use the local folder/sub-folder/nested folder method? Just be able to retrieve all the old emails and sort everything out later on?

Thank you in advance if you choose to respond to my post.
creator: mozilla395

title: Inconsistent connection to server from new computer
content:
I'm trying to replace my old, barely-working laptop with a new computer that I've built from spare parts. The old one ran Thunderbird 45.2.1 under Windows 7. The new one is running Thunderbird 102.6.1 under Windows 10.

My problem is that on the new computer Thunderbird is unable to connect to the server reliably. It actually downloads mail 10% to 20% of the time. The rest of the time it gives me an "authentication failure" message although the password is correct, or simply times out after about 80 seconds with no message at all.

On my old machine Thunderbird continues to work reliably.

I'm using the same connection settings on the new computer as on the old one.

I'm talking to the ISP about this, but they've run out of intelligent suggestions. They seem to be baffled be unwilling to admit it.

FWIW, the connection settings I'm using are:

Port: 995 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: Normal password Check for new messages every 10 minutes Leave messages on server for at most 7 days

Here's an example of inconsistent interaction that I captured today:

1. I tried to download new messages from one of my accounts, but intentionally entered an incorrect password. I got the message "Host contacted, sending login information" on the status line, then an "authentication failed" message after about 15 seconds.

2. I repeated operation #1, and again got "Host contacted..." followed by an "authentication failed" message after about 15 seconds.

3. I repeated operation #1, but entered the correct password. I got "Host contacted..." then an "authentication failed" message after about 15 seconds.

4. I repeated operation #3, with no change in the password or anything else. I got a successful download of email in about 10 seconds.

5. I tried to download new messages from another account, with the correct password. Thunderbird displayed "Host contacted..." After about 70 seconds the status line message went away, but no email was downloaded and no error was displayed.

6. I repeated step #5 and got the same result with a delay of about 80 seconds.

7. I repeated step #5 again and got the same result with a delay of about 80 seconds.

8. I repeated step #5 again but intentionally entered an incorrect password. I got "Host contacted..." then an "authentication failed" message after about 15 seconds.

9. I repeated step #8 and got "Host contacted..." then an "authentication failed" message after about 15 seconds.

10. I repeated step #5 and got the "Host contacted..." status line message. After about 15 seconds Thunderbird redisplayed the prompt to enter a password. It was not preceded by the "do you want to retry?" dialog that normally appears when authentication fails.

11. I repeated step #5 again. Thunderbird never prompted me for a password or displayed the "Host contacted..." message, but returned immediately to its quiescent state.

12. I repeated step #5 again. Thunderbird never prompted me for a password, but immediately started downloading messages.
creator: Jonathan.H

title: uso de la clave del certificado es inapropiada para la operación pretendida
content:
Al intentar enviar un mensaje (SMTP, 465 cifrado normal) no permite realizar el envío y aparece el siguiente mensaje: " El uso de la clave del certificado es inapropiada para la operación pretendida". La cuenta está configurada correctamente y permite realizar envíos sin ningún problema desde webmail o desde otros firefox. Pero en algunos, en concreto, muestra ese error y no sabemos cómo solucionarlo.

Un saludo
creator: SumoBot

title: Inbox emails have no content
content:
I have 3 emails accounts active on TB. On one of these accounts, only, the inbox emails display no content when I open any email. Completely blank. I tried the "repair folder" trick and all this did was delete the 'subject' titles for all emails contained within this 'inbox'. I can open any email in the 'trash' for this particular account and the content is still there and readable. All other accounts work fine. It is only the 'inbox' for this one account that has the issue. I have searched for 'inbox.msf' however my computer search cannot locate this file. It is not in the directory c:program files- mozilla firefox. I have deleted TB and reinstalled it with the latest version and the results are the same. Has anyone got an idea what is wrong?

Is there a problem with yahoo mail? I just created an account for my yahoo mail on Microsoft Mail. It has exactly the same issue as TB. On MS Mail I can read all my sent mail and deleted mail however there is no content in the inbox, why?
creator: bobdogator
